page.title: 18Legend of Simonside
page.content: One day a man was walking in the Simonside hills, notorious for being easy to lose your direction in. As daylight faded he became hopelessly lost then eagerly headed in the direction of a distant light. He found that it came from a house with a fire flickering inside. A gnome sat on a tree stump by the fire. The gnome seemed angry and signalled him to sit down and reach out for a stick to his left hand side. The man refused and the gnome grew angrier. Then the man suddenly fell asleep. He awoke to find that the gnome, the house and the fire were all gone and he was sitting on the edge of a cliff. Had he reached out for the stick, he would surely have fallen to his death. This is the legend of Simonside and a warning to those who would walk there alone.
